page.title: 08WELLINGBOROUGH'S SERVICES
page.content: THE RAILWAY STATION:Five people were interviewed at the railway station and the most common opinion was that people liked the station and thought that it was good enough although some thought that too much money had been spent on recent improvements.Most were satisfied with the efficiency of the service although one man felt that too much modernisation would spoil the character of the station. THE BUS STATION:There is not a proper bus station in the town and most people queueing up made complaints about the state of the shelters."Even inside the shelters you get wet",said an old man.Another man commented that he thought the shelters and a proper bus station should have been built where the WELLINGBOROUGH COLLEGE is erected.
